content: I'm a math undergraduate who, as a participant in Lean-centric academic extracurriculars, has embarked on a project centered around FRACTRAN, an alternative model for computability designed by John H. Conway with some remarkable properties. Here is the link to the GitHub repo; there are more details (linked to) in the README. It's still very early in the project, and I'm no expert yet. However, my professor suggested that I make a post here in case anybody is interested in my project. Maybe one day we will have something worthy of a mathlib contribution, who knows? I am pleased to introduce myself to you all, and thank you for your attention!
